forecasting.ui:description:
These knobs affect how DagNet estimates baseline conversion rates and how it blends forecast vs evidence when data is immature.

Because they change results, they should be committed and pulled like other shared configuration.

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings for the full explanation and examples.

RECENCY_HALF_LIFE_DAYS.ui:help:
Recency half-life for *mature* data contributing to the baseline forecast.

Indicative values: 7‚Äì14 (responsive), 30 (balanced), 60‚Äì90 (conservative), very large = effectively no recency weighting.

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.

LATENCY_MIN_EFFECTIVE_SAMPLE_SIZE.ui:help:
Stability guardrail for recency weighting.

Indicative values: 50‚Äì150 (responsive but noisier), 150‚Äì500 (typical), 500+ (very conservative).

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.

DEFAULT_T95_DAYS.ui:help:

Indicative values: 7‚Äì21 (typical), 30 (conservative default), 60‚Äì90 (very conservative).

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.

FORECAST_BLEND_LAMBDA.ui:help:
Forecast prior strength used when blending forecast vs evidence for immature data.

Indicative values: 0.05‚Äì0.20 (typical; default 0.15), 0.20‚Äì0.50 (more conservative), 0 (disables prior).

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.

LATENCY_BLEND_COMPLETENESS_POWER.ui:help:

Indicative values: 1.0 (canonical), 1.5‚Äì3.0 (typical; default 2.25), 3.0‚Äì5.0 (very conservative).

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.

ANCHOR_DELAY_BLEND_K_CONVERSIONS.ui:help:
Credibility threshold for trusting observed anchor-delay evidence (cohort-mode completeness on downstream edges).

Indicative values: 20‚Äì50 (responsive), 50‚Äì150 (typical; default 50), 150‚Äì300 (conservative).

See Help ‚Üí Forecasting settings.
